Border-district Republicans skeptical about Trump’s wall
House Republicans representing areas along the Mexican border are leery of
President Trump’s plan to build a wall through their districts.
Three Republican lawmakers say undertaking such a massive project will
fall short of alleviating the issues surrounding border security.
Rep. Will Hurd (R-Texas), who represents the largest region along the

And Reps. Martha McSally (R-Ariz.) and Steve Pearce (R-N.M.) have both
expressed skepticism about how effective the wall would be at stopping the
flow of people coming to the U.S. illegally.
Their lack of enthusiasm means there isn’t a single border-area lawmaker
who vocally supports the construction of a wall in their district.
